intro: Batrachium saganense, commonly known as the Sagan's batrachium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
